metadata.title: CVE-2024-27285 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
YARD is a Ruby Documentation tool. The "frames.html" file within the YardDoc's generated documentation is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)attacks due to inadequate sanitization of user input within the JavaScriptsegment of the "frames.erb" template file. This vulnerability is fixed in0.9.36.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27285` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

yard - 0.8.7.6+git20160220-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: yard package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8.7.6+git20160220-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
